title: Damnation
data:
***Version [0.27](/0.27 "0.27")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*This article is about the damage type. For the artefact crossbow by this name, see [Damnation (unrand)](/Damnation_\(unrand\) "Damnation (unrand)"). For the [demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation") see [Hurl Damnation (mutation)](/Hurl_Damnation_\(mutation\) "Hurl Damnation (mutation)").*

**Damnation** is an extremely dangerous damage type that is virtually irresistible. It is always dealt in 3×3-tile blasts that never miss and is one of the main threats in [Pandemonium](/Pandemonium "Pandemonium") and the [Hell](/Hell "Hell") branches.

## Contents

- [1 Monster spells](#Monster_spells)

  - [1.1 Hurl Damnation](#Hurl_Damnation)
  - [1.2 Call Down Damnation](#Call_Down_Damnation)

- [2 Damnation Sources for the Player](#Damnation_Sources_for_the_Player)

- [3 Damnation Resistance](#Damnation_Resistance)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 See Also](#See_Also)

## Monster spells

### Hurl Damnation

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Blasts a targeted enemy with damnation. These unholy forces harm the victim and anyone adjacent, and are not affected by any means of protection, such as armour or resistances. However, certain creatures, usually those able to invoke damnation themselves, are entirely unscathed by damnation. |

This spell has a range of 7, requires a line of sight to the target, and creates an unavoidable 3×3 burst. Damage in each tile is 3d20 damnation. The following enemies cast Hurl Damnation:

- & [![Asmodeus.png](/images/3/34/Asmodeus.png)](/File:Asmodeus.png) **[Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")** (3d20 damage)
- R [![Azrael.png](/images/f/fa/Azrael.png)](/File:Azrael.png) **[Azrael](/Azrael "Azrael")** (3d20 damage)
- 1 [![Brimstone Fiend.png](/images/9/93/Brimstone_Fiend.png)](/File:Brimstone_Fiend.png) **[Brimstone Fiend](/Brimstone_Fiend "Brimstone Fiend")** (3d20 damage)
- e [![Deep elf sorcerer.png](/images/2/2b/Deep_elf_sorcerer.png)](/File:Deep_elf_sorcerer.png) **[Deep elf sorcerer](/Deep_elf_sorcerer "Deep elf sorcerer")** (3d20 damage)
- & [![Dispater.png](/images/f/fa/Dispater.png)](/File:Dispater.png) **[Dispater](/Dispater "Dispater")** (3d20 damage)
- q [![Draconian scorcher.png](/images/1/11/Draconian_scorcher.png)](/File:Draconian_scorcher.png) **[Draconian scorcher](/Draconian_scorcher "Draconian scorcher")** (3d20 damage)
- 1 [![Hell Sentinel.png](/images/d/dd/Hell_Sentinel.png)](/File:Hell_Sentinel.png) **[Hell Sentinel](/Hell_Sentinel "Hell Sentinel")** (3d20 damage)
- @ [![Hellbinder.png](/images/0/08/Hellbinder.png)](/File:Hellbinder.png) **[Hellbinder](/Hellbinder "Hellbinder")** (3d20 damage)

### Call Down Damnation

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | Blasts a targeted enemy with damnation, with no direct line of fire required. These unholy forces harm the victim and anyone adjacent, and are not affected by any means of protection, such as armour or resistances. However, certain creatures, usually those able to invoke damnation themselves, are entirely unscathed by damnation. |

This version uses [smite-targeting](/Smite-targeting "Smite-targeting") to direct a 3×3 burst of damnation against targets in LOS. Damage is 3d15. The following enemies cast Call Down Damnation:

- R [![Azrael.png](/images/f/fa/Azrael.png)](/File:Azrael.png) **[Azrael](/Azrael "Azrael")** (3d15 damage)
- e [![Deep elf high priest.png](/images/c/cc/Deep_elf_high_priest.png)](/File:Deep_elf_high_priest.png) **[Deep elf high priest](/Deep_elf_high_priest "Deep elf high priest")** (3d15 damage)
- q [![Draconian scorcher.png](/images/1/11/Draconian_scorcher.png)](/File:Draconian_scorcher.png) **[Draconian scorcher](/Draconian_scorcher "Draconian scorcher")** (3d15 damage)
- 2 [![Hellion.png](/images/c/cf/Hellion.png)](/File:Hellion.png) **[Hellion](/Hellion "Hellion")** (3d15 damage)

The following enemies may be able to cast Call Down Damnation, depending on their spell set:

- & [![Pandemonium lord.png](/images/c/c6/Pandemonium_lord.png)](/File:Pandemonium_lord.png) **[Pandemonium lord](/Pandemonium_lord "Pandemonium lord")** (5.2% chance)

## Damnation Sources for the Player

There are few methods available for players to gain access to Hurl Damnation. They are all found in the late game, and usually require a heavy cost to use. (Call Down Damnation cannot be used by players by any means.)

- [![Staff of dispater.png](/images/3/38/Staff_of_dispater.png)](/File:Staff_of_dispater.png) Evoking the [Staff of Dispater](/Staff_of_Dispater "Staff of Dispater") will reliably cast Hurl Damnation (`Power = Evocations * 8`, max damage 3d42), but at a cost of 14 HP and 4 MP.
- [![Urand damnation.png](/images/3/30/Urand_damnation.png)](/File:Urand_damnation.png) Bolts fired with [the arbalest "Damnation"](/Damnation_\(unrand\) "Damnation (unrand)") cause damnation damage.
- The [Hurl Damnation](/Hurl_Damnation_\(mutation\) "Hurl Damnation (mutation)") [Demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation") allows you to cast Hurl Damnation at rank 3 (damage based on [XL](/XL "XL"), max 3d42 at level 27) but at a cost of 15% of your max HP per use.

All player-launched sources of damnation require a line of sight and create an unavoidable 3×3 burst.

## Damnation Resistance

Some monsters (typically [demons](/Demon "Demon")) possess [damnation resistance](/Category:Damnation_resistance "Category:Damnation resistance"), rendering them immune to damage from damnation. Players cannot acquire damnation immunity; the only possible way to reduce damnation damage is the [damage-shaving](/Deep_dwarf#Damage_Reduction "Deep dwarf") ability of [deep dwarves](/Deep_dwarves "Deep dwarves").

## History

- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), damnation was known as hellfire and counted as [fire](/Fire "Fire") damage in addition to being irresistible. The Hellfire Burst spell was renamed to Call Down Damnation, and Hellfire is now Hurl Damnation.

## See Also

[List of damnation-resistant monsters](/Category:Damnation_resistance "Category:Damnation resistance")

Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.27: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

This article is about the damage type. For the artefact crossbow by this name, see Damnation (unrand). For the demonspawn mutation see Hurl Damnation (mutation).

Damnation is an extremely dangerous damage type that is virtually irresistible. It is always dealt in 3×3-tile blasts that never miss and is one of the main threats in Pandemonium and the Hell branches.

Contents

  • 1 Monster spells
    • 1.1 Hurl Damnation
    • 1.2 Call Down Damnation
  • 2 Damnation Sources for the Player
  • 3 Damnation Resistance
  • 4 History
  • 5 See Also

Monster spells

Hurl Damnation

Blasts a targeted enemy with damnation. These unholy forces harm the victim and anyone adjacent, and are not affected by any means of protection, such as armour or resistances. However, certain creatures, usually those able to invoke damnation themselves, are entirely unscathed by damnation.

This spell has a range of 7, requires a line of sight to the target, and creates an unavoidable 3×3 burst. Damage in each tile is 3d20 damnation. The following enemies cast Hurl Damnation:

  • & Asmodeus (3d20 damage)
  • R Azrael (3d20 damage)
  • 1 Brimstone Fiend (3d20 damage)
  • e Deep elf sorcerer (3d20 damage)
  • & Dispater (3d20 damage)
  • q Draconian scorcher (3d20 damage)
  • 1 Hell Sentinel (3d20 damage)
  • @ Hellbinder (3d20 damage)

Call Down Damnation

Blasts a targeted enemy with damnation, with no direct line of fire required. These unholy forces harm the victim and anyone adjacent, and are not affected by any means of protection, such as armour or resistances. However, certain creatures, usually those able to invoke damnation themselves, are entirely unscathed by damnation.

This version uses smite-targeting to direct a 3×3 burst of damnation against targets in LOS. Damage is 3d15. The following enemies cast Call Down Damnation:

  • R Azrael (3d15 damage)
  • e Deep elf high priest (3d15 damage)
  • q Draconian scorcher (3d15 damage)
  • 2 Hellion (3d15 damage)

The following enemies may be able to cast Call Down Damnation, depending on their spell set:

  • & Pandemonium lord (5.2% chance)

Damnation Sources for the Player

There are few methods available for players to gain access to Hurl Damnation. They are all found in the late game, and usually require a heavy cost to use. (Call Down Damnation cannot be used by players by any means.)

  • Evoking the Staff of Dispater will reliably cast Hurl Damnation (Power = Evocations * 8, max damage 3d42), but at a cost of 14 HP and 4 MP.
  • Bolts fired with the arbalest "Damnation" cause damnation damage.
  • The Hurl Damnation Demonspawn mutation allows you to cast Hurl Damnation at rank 3 (damage based on XL, max 3d42 at level 27) but at a cost of 15% of your max HP per use.

All player-launched sources of damnation require a line of sight and create an unavoidable 3×3 burst.

Damnation Resistance

Some monsters (typically demons) possess damnation resistance, rendering them immune to damage from damnation. Players cannot acquire damnation immunity; the only possible way to reduce damnation damage is the damage-shaving ability of deep dwarves.

History

  • Prior to 0.18, damnation was known as hellfire and counted as fire damage in addition to being irresistible. The Hellfire Burst spell was renamed to Call Down Damnation, and Hellfire is now Hurl Damnation.

See Also

List of damnation-resistant monsters
